record.id: field.name=NULL and file.name="msgclass" and term=NULL and format.name="msgclass.log" and syslanguage="en"
record.file.name: msgclass
record.format.name: msgclass.log

brief.brief: Displays messages logged in the msglog table.
You can set up this type of message in addition to or instead of screen display messages.

detail.detail: The message log is available for display and printing by using the option on the System Administrator Menu (Display Message Log) or by using the Database Manager on the msglog table.
Purge the message log regularly. It keeps growing if you do not purge it.
An easy way to do this is to access the msglog table, select the appropriate records to purge, and select Mass Delete on the search list.
You may want to print the records before deleting them.
To do this, select Mass Print and then Mass Delete.
